channel.title: datasette on HIST4806A Museums + Digital History
channel.description: Recent content in datasette on HIST4806A Museums + Digital History

item.title: So what can you do with an API anyway?
item.description: At this point in the class, you’ve started wrestling and wrangling the physical records describing some of the materials in our three partner museums. You’re thinking through how to digitize this material - or you should be, make sure to read the relevant how-tos! - and how to organize it into a flat table. You have guidance on how to publish this data online. But… you might be quietly worried about what one does with such data, once it’s online.

item.title: Publishing Data to the Web with Heroku and Datasette
item.description: Please note that this course website is equipped with the Hypothes.is annotation layer. If these instructions are unclear, or I’ve forgotten something crucial, let me know: please highlight the relevant text and leave an annotation in our class Hypothesis group to alert me. Prerequisites You need to have the following installed on your machine: Python. I recommend using Anaconda to manage all of your python related work.
